attributes.action: Make a binding pledge that the UK will not sign-up to the new UN anti-blasphemy directive
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A number of Islamic countries have got the UN to pass a non-binding (as of yet) resolution regarding anti-blasphemy laws.  This means that anyone who criticises a religion can be put in prison.

This resolution is clearly just to protect the interests of one religion - Islam.

No religion is above criticism.

This resolution, if adopted and enforced by the UK will completely destroy free-speech.

The Prime Minister should make a binding pledge to the British people that our country will not adopt this draconian law and therefore will continue to allow free-speech.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
